title: Quark Indesign Line above/below thing?
content:
There used to be something in Quark called, something like, Line above/Line below. This allowed you to have a line above the first line of copy etc.

Does anyone know how to do this in Indesign, the only way I can figure is to use underline but this seems a little strange because how would you get the line above a first line of copy???

Can anyone help?

Cheers  
Steve
author: NatureBoy

comments.content:
Do you mean a line of space or a rule (line)?

For space, see the icon which looks like space above text in the Paragraph palette.

For rules, see Rules under the Paragraph palette or Paragraph style sheets.

Hi Steve,

Mr Bald Condensed is your man:  
 [Getting creative with Paragraph Rules pt. 1](http://web.archive.org/web/20100509205600/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=262) and [pt. 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20100509205600/http:/www.fontshop.be/details.php?entry=290).
